title: As Zelensky Visits Kherson, World Bank Says Ukraine Needs $411 Billion to Rebuild
description: The bank released a significantly higher figure as European Union leaders approved plans to provide Kyiv with one million artillery shells over the next 12 months.

title: Track and Field Keeps Ban on Russia and Belarus, Adding to Debate on Olympics
description: Another similar ban by the council that oversees ice hockey shows the issue has not waned.

title: American Hopes for Canadian Military Leadership in Haiti Likely to Be Dashed
description: The United States had hoped that its neighbor would lead a major intervention, but Canada lacks resources and is skeptical of its value.

title: U.S. and Canada Reach an Agreement on Turning Away Asylum Seekers
description: The deal allows both countries to turn back people who cross their borders without authorization at a time when migration has surged.

title: Your Friday Briefing: U.S. Lawmakers Blast TikTok’s C.E.O.
description: Also, a World Bank estimate on the cost to rebuild Ukraine and a prison sentence for India’s opposition leader.

title: Spain’s Prime Minister to Visit Xi in China to Discuss Ukraine
description: China has been trying to build support for its proposal to start peace talks, but Ukraine’s allies hold that its call for an immediate cease-fire would only help Russia consolidate territorial gains.

title: Slovakia Makes Its First Delivery of Pledged Soviet-Era Fighter Jets to Ukraine
description: The arrival of the aging MIG-29s is not expected to significantly change battlefield dynamics, and the planes will likely be used for spare parts for Ukraine’s own Soviet-era jets.

title: Canada Hits Record Population Growth Through Immigration
description: The country grew by over 1 million people last year, almost all newcomers, as the federal government pushes more immigration to plug labor shortages.

title: The U.K.’s Wave of Strikes Explained: Why Is It Ending?
description: For months, labor disputes rattled Britain, disrupting transportation, the mail and even medical procedures. Now, tensions seem to have eased.

title: In Israel, Another Divisive Law on Another Day of Mass Protest
description: Amid a national crisis over a planned judicial overhaul, Parliament approved a bill protecting the prime minister from being declared unfit to govern.

title: E.U. Leaders Meet to Discuss Aid to Ukraine
description: The 27 E.U. heads of state are expected to finalize plans to supply Ukraine with one million rounds of ammunition over the next year. Here is what we’re covering:

title: New Day of Strikes in France as Pension Anger Persists
description: Labor unions are hoping for a show of strength after President Emmanuel Macron insisted that the new legal retirement age of 64 would be enforced, despite its deep unpopularity.

title: The Threat of TikTok
description: U.S. officials say TikTok is a national security risk. They’re trying to turn it into their advantage.

title: Leader of Indian Party Opposing Modi Is Sentenced in Defamation Case
description: Rahul Gandhi, who leads the main opposition party, received a two-year sentence after making a comment in 2019 criticizing Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Migration Tops Agenda as Biden Visits Canada
description: As migration has swelled at Canada’s border, the country is seeking a renegotiation of an agreement with the United States that binds it to accept asylum seekers at unofficial crossing points.

title: West African Commandos Train to Battle Terrorists by Land and Sea
description: As terrorists move south through the Sahel, the Pentagon’s annual Flintlock exercise reinforced the rule of law in a region roiled by coups.

title: Ukrainian Commanders Frustrated With Slow Pace of Western Tank Deliveries
description: For now, they are holding on with inferior Soviet-era tanks, but relish the idea of taking on the Russians with modern Western battle tanks.
